unit_learning_outcomes.description: Describe and synthesise the contextual and doctrinal features of directors’ duties.
Evaluate the effectiveness of corporate legislation and its impact on the corporation and corporate stakeholders
Critically analyse and articulate (orally and in writing) the substantive corporate law rules in legislation and case law
Apply relevant corporate and commercial law principles to resolve complex legal problems.
Describe and critically analyse the complex interactions between corporate law, history and social context

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: weekly readings according to a schedule to be released on iLearn

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to JD and (LAWS8030 or LAWS803)

assessments.description: Quiz testing students' understanding of company law
A time limited take home exam testing student's understanding of company law

assessments.assessment_title: Online and in class participatory tasks
assessments.description: A series of online and face to face activities including legal problem solving, discussion forums and debates that draw on students' understanding of the lectures and required readings

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 2, Infrequent attendance, North Ryde
data.description: This unit studies the nature, formation and management of the modern corporation. It examines the consequences of the adoption of corporate form including the separation of legal personality between the company and its shareholders and the impact of limited liability. The extensive common law and statutory regulatory regime applicable to directors and other company officers in the management of the company is surveyed as is the important role of shareholders' rights in governing this entity. The examination of the corporation is undertaken in the context of globalisation where the proliferation of corporate governance codes is increasing.
data.title: Company Law

title: Company Law
